The overall burden of HIV in the Sub-Saharan African region attributed to injection drug use is limited, and specific data about young PWID remain largely invisible in routine HIV surveillance and surveys. This has a major consequence on the effectiveness of harm reduction policies and programs since they are largely designed for adult PWID [ 11].
